intro: Tordylium trachycarpum, commonly known as the rough-seeded tordylium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically elliptical and covered in fine, stiff hairs. Tordylium trachycarpum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
